Class QuizzleDatabase

java.lang.Object
QuizzleDatabase
public class QuizzleDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
As the class name suggests, this is the QuizzleServer's database. The QuizzleDatabase class, in fact, take cares of storing and serializing all fo the QuizzleServer's persistent informations, such as the users nicknames and passwords, the users friend lists and the users scores. All the serialization is handled with the Jackson library.

    Constructors

    QuizzleDatabase()
    Returns a new QuizzleDatabase.

  • Constructor Details

    • QuizzleDatabase

      public QuizzleDatabase()
      Returns a new QuizzleDatabase.

  • Method Details

    • setScore

      public void setScore​(java.lang.String nickname, int score)
      Sets the user's nickname score.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the user's nickname.
      score - the user's score.

    • insertUser

      public boolean insertUser​(java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String password)
      Inserts the user in the concurrent hash map if absent and returns true else it returns false if the nickname is already registered. Also serializes the database.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the user's nickname.
      password - the user's password.
      Returns:
      true if the user has been added false otherwise.

    • addFriend

      protected boolean addFriend​(java.lang.String nickname, java.lang.String friendNickname)
      Adds the user friendNickname to the user nickname friends list.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the user that is adding the friend.
      friendNickname - the friend to be added.
      Returns:
      true if the friend has been added false otherwise.

    • retrieveUser

      protected QuizzleUser retrieveUser​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Retrieves the user nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the user nickname.
      Returns:
      the QuizzleUser named nickname.

    • serialize

      protected java.lang.String serialize() throws java.io.IOException
      The QuizzleDatabase serialization method. Upon invocation writes on disk userDB. The corresponding .json file is Database.json
      Returns:
      a string containing userDB.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something fishy happens while opening and writing the file.

    • deserialize

      protected void deserialize()
      The deserialization method, called on QuizzleServer start.
